lead_paragraph: A chart last Sunday with the Keeping Score column listing baseball players who finished a decade in the top three in home runs and runs batted in gave incorrect information for the 1980s and the 2000s. Mike Schmidt’s R.B.I. total in the 1980s was 929, not 829. Besides Alex Rodriguez, Albert Pujols was also a top-three finisher in the two categories in the 2000s, with 366 homers and 1,112 R.B.I. And Manny Ramirez, with 348 home runs and 1,106 R.B.I., was erroneously included in the 2000s.
